required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing for Healing of Donor Site Wounds
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Active-controlled, Single-blind, Parallel Two-group Trial of HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing and Sidaiyi® Wound Dressing for the Treatment of Donor Site Wounds

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing for repair of donor site wounds. Half of participants will receive HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing, while the other half will receive Sidaiyi® wound dressing.

detailed_description.textblock:
HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing is a transparent, non-porous, pliable, gas-permeable, and waterproof film dressing which is comprised of silk fibroin protein of the Bombyx mori (B. mori) silkworm. It is intended to provide a moist, gas-permeable and sterile environment to facilitate the normal wound healing process. It is used in the management of non-infected skin defects and various dermal wounds.
Sidaiyi® wound dressing (Suzhou Soho Biomaterial Science and Technology Co., Ltd, Suzhou, China) is a CFDA approved (Su2012-2640182), silk fibroin-based, two-layered spongy dressing. Upon the silk fibroin spongy dressing layer is a membrane made of medical silicone. It is used in the management of partial- and full-thickness wounds, donor site wounds and burns. Currently, it is the sole silk fibroin biomaterial for wound healing that has received regulatory approval worldwide.

primary_outcome.description: Healing time was recorded when complete re-epithelialization had occurred. If the wound healed in advance, visit until the wound was completely healed. If the wounds were unable to heal for more than 21±3 days, unanticipated follow-ups were added until the wound was completely healed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Growth of Granulation Tissue
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment of tissue with healthy granulation tissue defined as is granular and uneven in texture, does not bleed easily and is pink in color. Unhealthy granulation tissue is typically dark which can be indicative of poor perfusion, ischemia and/or infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Inflammatory Reaction
secondary_outcome.description: Physician assessment determined presence of inflammatory reaction which is characterized by pain, heat, redness and swelling.
The amount of pain that a patient perceived was assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0-10), which ranges across a continuum from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain).

arm_group.description: After harvesting the graft, the donor site wounds were treated with the dressing material. Dressing changes if needed. An operative removal of the HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing is not required as it becomes spontaneously detached from the regenerated skin areas.
After harvesting the graft, the donor site wounds were treated with the dressing material. Dressing changes if needed.

The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

group.title: HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing

group.title: Sidaiyi® Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed Sidaiyi® wound dressing

group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed Sidaiyi® wound dressing

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Growth of Granulation Tissue
outcome.description: Physician assessment of tissue with healthy granulation tissue defined as is granular and uneven in texture, does not bleed easily and is pink in color. Unhealthy granulation tissue is typically dark which can be indicative of poor perfusion, ischemia and/or infection.

group.title: HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing

group.title: Sidaiyi® Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed Sidaiyi® wound dressing

measure.title: Number of Participants With Growth of Granulation Tissue
measure.description: Physician assessment of tissue with healthy granulation tissue defined as is granular and uneven in texture, does not bleed easily and is pink in color. Unhealthy granulation tissue is typically dark which can be indicative of poor perfusion, ischemia and/or infection.

analysis.groups_desc: Two-sided Fisher's exact test was performed to assess statistically significant differences of the data of the Number of Participants with Growth of Granulation Tissue between the group treated with the HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing and that treated with the Sidaiyi® wound dressing. This Statistical Analysis applies to the "Participants with healthy granulation tissue" and the "Participants with unhealthy granulation tissue" category.
analysis.p_value_desc: Values of p < 0.05 were considered to be significantly different.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Inflammatory Reaction
outcome.description: Physician assessment determined presence of inflammatory reaction which is characterized by pain, heat, redness and swelling.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Inflammatory Reaction
measure.description: Physician assessment determined presence of inflammatory reaction which is characterized by pain, heat, redness and swelling.

analysis.groups_desc: Two-sided Fisher's exact test was performed to assess statistically significant differences of the data of the Number of Participants with Inflammatory Reaction between the group treated with the HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing and that treated with the Sidaiyi® wound dressing. This Statistical Analysis applies to the "Participants with Inflammatory Reaction" and the "Participants without Inflammatory Reaction" category.
analysis.p_value_desc: Values of p < 0.05 were considered to be significantly different.

outcome.title: Pain Perceived by Patient
outcome.description: The amount of pain that a patient perceived was assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0-10), which ranges across a continuum from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain).

group.title: HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing

group.title: Sidaiyi® Wound Dressing
group.description: Dressing indicated for donor site wounds. Dressing changes every 2-3 days, more frequently if needed Sidaiyi® wound dressing

measure.title: Pain Perceived by Patient
measure.description: The amount of pain that a patient perceived was assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS 0-10), which ranges across a continuum from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain).

analysis.groups_desc: Two-sided t-test was performed to assess statistically significant differences of the data of the VAS score between the group treated with the HQ® Matrix Medical Wound Dressing and that treated with the Sidaiyi® wound dressing.
analysis.p_value_desc: Values of p < 0.05 were considered to be significantly different.

This Statistical Analysis applies to "No exudation" and "Little exudation" category.
analysis.p_value_desc: Values of p < 0.05 were considered to be significantly different.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
